text:
e="preserve">Kevin Patrick Curran (February 27, 1957 – October 25, 2016) was an American television comedy writer. He is best known for writing for "Late Night with David Letterman", "Married... with Children" and "The Simpsons". He had 20 Emmy Award nominations to his name.
Curran was born in Hartford, Connecticut. He was in a relationship with British author Helen Fielding from 1999 until his own death in 2016. The couple had two children.
On October 25, 2016, Curran died of cancer in West Hollywood, California. He was 59.
